website_summaries.verdict: Disassembled bones can be used in a variety of ways.
pros: Includes one hand and foot articulated and the other hand and foot disarticulated
Spine attached to a string for convenience
Set includes more than 200 bones and a 3D skeletal poster
Slightly lower price point than similar models
cons: Bones are not designed to be assembled, requires additional storage

customer_reviews.title: Helpful 💜
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for me when I was studying bones for my anatomy class. And it was really really helpful. The bones are anatomically correct. I can see no difference between these bones and the bones we use at school. And guess what? I got a 100% on our lab practical! I recommend buying this.
customer_reviews.author: RosieSHines

customer_reviews.title: For Lab Class
customer_reviews.text: These got such great reviews that I ordered one on spec, and it was so good that I ordered 4 more for an Introductory course on Human Origins. They have a surprising amount of detail, the package contains all the bones, and they are well made and heavy-duty so they won't break with the fumbling and manhandling of 300 inexperienced students per year. We use real bones for our advanced courses, but these are great for courses where students need to learn basic bones and bone features. Best of all they are affordable!! The administration was delighted to approve $500 for skeletons since they had just paid 40K to outfit another bioanth lab with casts from a more scientific source.
customer_reviews.author: JLC

customer_reviews.title: Need a bone to pick? This one's a winner!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my daughter and she loves it! She's named it Napoleon Bone Apart (gotta love the Biologist's sense of humor). She loves how it has soft gel like plastic disks for the cartilage and the bones have surface indentations to resemble real bones. She said the skull opens so you can put a brain in there or use it as a candy dish. There is also a diagram with labels. My daughter calls it a road map, which is full color and able to be framed. She just loves this diarticulated skeleton. Definitely a must have for those into A & P.
customer_reviews.author: Lenora S. Murph

customer_reviews.title: Grade Saver!
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently taking pre-med/pre-nursing college level human anatomy class. This skeleton just might save me and my grade on my first test which will include the whole skeleton system. Why? Because our professor will lay out random bones and we have to identify them/label them on a diagram and explain all details/areas of the bones. This skeleton is VERY USEFUL to test myself. I'm VERY HAPPY WITH THE PRODUCT AND PRICE! Some of the bones, like the big leg bones, are a bit difficult to figure out due to the lack of detail and they way they were cut. However, overall, for this cheap price, THIS IS A MUST for anyone going into nursing/PA/MD/etc.
customer_reviews.author: zoshes

customer_reviews.title: I Will Update as I go Through Each Bone
customer_reviews.text: So far it's not terrible more the money, but it's certainly not completely accurate for a human osteology class. So far: No posterior or inferior gluteal lines on the ilium, and the anterior gluteal line looks like a string that was glued on and then covered in plastic. The sacrum has what I'd assume is supposed to be accessory superior articular facets. It has no clear crests besides the median crest and is also missing the intervertebral foramina.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren M.

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: Was hesitant on ordering this due to the price, but it was SO worth it!! It was amazing for studying and has helped me ace my Anatomy Lab! If you're taking Anatomy and want a leg up in the course I highly recommend ordering this for studying, it is absolutely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Carley Byrum

customer_reviews.title: Anatomy Was A Breeze
customer_reviews.text: Medical Student Review: Pros: -This has just enough detail to land you an A in your Anatomy class (it did for me). -If you are a procrastinator like me, you can stay up late one night learning all of the landmarks of each bone. Cons: -None that I can think of off the top of my head. Like I said, it helped me get the grade I wanted in class. Half of my classmates purchased the same product and we were all happy.
customer_reviews.author: Pink Panther

customer_reviews.title: I love this!!
customer_reviews.text: So cool, it help me pass my anatomy class and lab practicum with an A. I love that the spine is on a string and the ribs are labeled left and right for you. This is not meant to be assembled together, but just to study each bone individually :) very helpful, I am a visual and kinesthetic learner so it was very handy
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great for Medical or Nursing students
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter who is a Nursing student in another state. She rally felt this an excellent product to learn the bones and all the particular parts of the bones. She will also use this for her husband who will be going to college for physical therapy assistant in the near future. She loved this skeleton, well worth the money to help her get through the accelerated program with A grades.
customer_reviews.author: annar2662

customer_reviews.title: 2 left scapulas :*(
customer_reviews.text: I truly loved my bones until I realized that I was sent 2 left scapulas. Generally this would not seem like such a huge issue, but when studying for a bone practical where bones must be labeled as left or right, having 2 left scapulas doesn't really help. I will be reaching out to the seller in hopes that this will be corrected. I will update and reevaluate my review afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Susan P

customer_reviews.title: Great Study Tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for studying the skeletal system in preparation for my practical exam. It has the features I need to memorize, and I appreciate that one hand and one foot are assembled, while the other hand and foot are disarticulated. I do think it is the best value for the price. All the "bones" arrived intact and nothing was missing.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine91

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Helped me get a 97% on my lab practical
customer_reviews.text: This saved my whole semester! Im taking anatomy and physiology and this was a game changer for me. Being able to touch the bones study the processes and tuberocitys and hold them up to my body helped me remember them! They are literally the same quality of the bones we used in class to study.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Worst skull but nice femur.
customer_reviews.text: Bones were ok ok but the skull was the worst out of all. So many uneven holes that can actually confuse you and make you fail your test. The only bone that was good was the femur. Also the bones were very rough and many poky stuffs hanging out of the bones probably because they are cheapyl made. Sadly will be returning as I really am not interested in failing my exam by looking at the bones with wrong structures.
customer_reviews.author: Tsering youdon

customer_reviews.title: terrible
customer_reviews.text: had to glue it together took me 4 days get one with assembly kit cannot stand , and the rib cage is non symmetrical: on one side the ribs a re 3 inch shorter, is a defective model. has only 1 hand and one foot , this chinese thing is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya and John C.

customer_reviews.title: Duplicate Bones
customer_reviews.text: I had two left femurs instead of one right and one left. Other than that it was pretty much what I expected. Good for high school osteology or biology classes, but not for a college level course. Some features are absent.
customer_reviews.author: TWoods

customer_reviews.title: Anatomically Correct
customer_reviews.text: Everything was there. It appears anatomically accurate. I think it would've been nice to have tiny holes through the bones to string the skeleton together to hang it. It is great for studying and identifying individual bones for my AP1 class
customer_reviews.author: Knoxville, TN

customer_reviews.title: Bones  Abide
customer_reviews.text: I love the bones. We are a small, yet award-winning avant-garde theater company in San Diego CA, We have been zoon-rehearsing for our next Golden Corpse show BONES ABIDE to present Post-Covid Quarantine. The dis-articulated bones are an important prop to this show about suffering, recovery and hope.
customer_reviews.author: pickle

customer_reviews.title: Quality product at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Such a great buy! Being able to be hands on helped me immensely while studying for an A&P practical. The bones come with all the detail needed (for A&P1) at a great price. Definitely worth it! Added bonus that I had a question about a the bones sent and was pleasantly surprised with a shockingly fast, easy and pleasant response from customer service. We had a back and forth until my question was thoroughly answered. Such a great company to work with and 5 star experience overall!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good attention to detail but missing a piece.
customer_reviews.text: Good details in the models. I use the skeleton to study for my Human Osteology courses. The only issues I have with it is that two teeth on the maxilla were cracked and I was sent two L1 vertebraes, but I not sent an L4 vertebrae. So, if you get the model make sure to check your vertebrae. The teeth are not detailed enough to use to study the differences in the tooth types, but that is not why I bought the skeleton.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Had everything and more for anatomy and physiology. All parts were there. A few bones had mold marks, considering the price I’m more than willing to deal with it. One hand and foot are articulated, other side is not. No brainer buy if you don’t need the highest quality (and highest price) nonarticualted skeleton.
customer_reviews.author: TJ H.

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!
customer_reviews.text: Its quite humerus how often I use these in my med school studies. Having an osteoblast time studying with these! I know with this bone set it’s going tibia okay!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing detail worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Love love love!!!!!!!! The detail is AMAZING!!! Completely worth it I’m super happy with my purchase using it for my nursing pre requs because I don’t have time to go to the SL nothing like having your own! Did not expect this much detail!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased by detail and customer service
customer_reviews.text: Incredible detail, because It was cast from an actual skeleton you can see the individual characteristics of that person instead of just an ambiguous persona that a lot of medical skeletons are. I did accidentally receive two left femurs, however the company was incredibly fast and accommodating to replace the correct femur for no extra charge. Highly recommend for studying!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Great set of bones
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for an anatomy and physiology class for nursing school, and they were extremely helpful to learn all the bones.
customer_reviews.author: StefanieTyler

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality!
customer_reviews.text: This skeleton is perfect for studying bones in my anatomy class, and I could not be happier! Super nice quality for the price and all of the pieces of the skeleton came in plastic bags to group certain bones together. Extremely useful product!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie F. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Good accuracy! Skull could be a bit better but it has everything that an anatomy 1 student would need. Seems durable.
customer_reviews.author: Fay C.

customer_reviews.title: Missing tibia
customer_reviews.text: I was going to spend a weekend becoming a bone expert for A&P 1. Major bummer that the QC standards at the vendor’s shipping department is lacking. I’ll just try and “limp” along. The bones I did get have enough detail in features to identify. The manufacturer included the cervical foramina in the transverse processes, which is nice. I hope that randomly leaving out bones is not an attempt to increase profits.
customer_reviews.author: Sad A&P Student

customer_reviews.title: Works great if you're studying individual bones
customer_reviews.text: Great for studying anatomy and physiology. All of the skeleton except for the skull, one hand, and one foot come in separate pieces. Works great if you're studying individual
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for my daughter who is a nursing major in college. She kept the bones in her dorm room, which allowed her time outside anatomy lab to study the many bones. The skeleton is heavy. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Long time prime customer

customer_reviews.title: Helped me get an A and great to talk to
customer_reviews.text: Helped me ace the practicals in anatomy and physiology 1 lab. My skeleton’s name is Ned. He was Lord Eddard Stark of Winterfell but now that he’s dead it’s just Ned. Also children love him!
customer_reviews.author: Nelson Soto-Perez

customer_reviews.title: Great but broken!
customer_reviews.text: Product is great however part of the sternum was broken when we open the package... My daughter needs this for PT school and was disappointed that it was broken off.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Balsam

customer_reviews.title: Great for college student
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Only complaint is the poster wasn’t 3D as stated it was just a plain poster
customer_reviews.author: Shelbie1

customer_reviews.title: Great for A&P
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for learning all of the bones for my anatomy and physiology class! Helped me pass the class
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it! These bones actually show more detail than the skeletons they have at my school, so it was easy for me to find all the different parts I needed to study for my exam.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! Helped me make a A on my bone lab exam!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Jade

customer_reviews.title: Anatomically accurate
customer_reviews.text: I have used this skeleton so much! it's a must if you are taking anatomy. It's great and the price is not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Christensen

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. It was perfect to study for my A&P class. The bones were exact to real bones I had no problem identifying them.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed to study for my Anatomy & ...
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to study for my Anatomy & Physiology I course! I do wish that it had separate bones from the skull in addition to the complete skull, but it'll do.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Accurate for anatomy studying
customer_reviews.text: This unarticulated skeleton is fantastic, we use the same ones in my college class so it’s great to go home and resume studying with the same materials. It’s very high quality and anatomically accurate with all the landmarks on the bones. Only issue is I have two right fibulas..
customer_reviews.author: Haley Elledge

customer_reviews.title: Want an A in Anatomy and Physiology?
customer_reviews.text: Excellent item. Extremely helpful in Anatomy and Physiology class. All the necessary landmarks are present.
customer_reviews.author: Andi Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Usefulness and very closely accurate to study with
customer_reviews.text: I was taking an physical anthropology class and we were studying the human skeletal system. Was very useful to have and use for learning the location of the features and elements of it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Byl

customer_reviews.title: This set of bones was affordable and a great quality for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I needed this skeleton for a human osteology course. This set of bones was affordable and a great quality for my needs. The right hand and right foot came articulated while the left were disarticulated. The mandible can be taken off for examination as well as the top of the skull to see inside. All in all I would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: nicole

customer_reviews.title: great for my A&P class got an A and learned ...
customer_reviews.text: great for my A&P class got an A and learned a lot easier with the bones in front of me. cant assemble to full skeleton though
customer_reviews.author: Ivelina Nedelcheva

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Accurate features
customer_reviews.text: Great product, very similar to the SOMSO models I use in class!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Looks good however they gave me two left femurs and 2 right fibulas... Other than that though it is a great value. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: Just as described & looks in pics
customer_reviews.text: Helped me study for my bones and muscles exam for anatomy!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Great Skeleton with great bone markings!
customer_reviews.text: This skeleton was perfect for studying for my bone test in A&P 1! I got 110 on my test! It has great bone markings and I thought it was very comparable to the ones at my university! If you are trying to decide, this one is great, I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Suprisingly Great Quality for the cost!
customer_reviews.text: I expected a low quality reproduction given the cost. I was, however, very pleased with the quality and look of the model when It arrived. I have had to purchase much of my own teaching material and this was a very happy surprise!
customer_reviews.author: Demetri

customer_reviews.title: It’s not as good as the high priced or real skeleton but it ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality. Especially considering the price. I am using it in my A&P classroom. It’s not as good as the high priced or real skeleton but it makes a great third study option.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Harbin

customer_reviews.title: An Honestly A Great Skeleton For The Price.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical about this item. The price is incredible in comparison to other disarticulated skeletons. Yes there are some small rough edges where a little extra plaster was left, and a few ribs are a bit curlier than the others, but over all it's great and it's perfect for studying!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor McGregor

customer_reviews.title: Nicely detailed***
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful quality, nicely detailed, comes together packed safely and will be useful for students, families, people who want to learn about anatomy and bone structure
customer_reviews.author: Fred W.

customer_reviews.title: Linda Reyes
customer_reviews.text: HbmBarsco you are amazing. The product arrime as describe it. Well made and in excelente conditions. I just love it!!! Just amazing for muy lectures. HBarsci heló me a lot thetas are just amazing definetely I will buy from them again. Excelent quality!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda R.

customer_reviews.title: All anatomy students should buy disarticulated human skeleton
customer_reviews.text: Best purchased I made for human anatomy class, best study guide, come with free skeletal system poster love it. I used it everyday now, naming all bones in the skull to the feet. anatomy is crazy hard the disarticulated human skeleton made it easy for me. hands on bones.
customer_reviews.author: kristina

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bones
customer_reviews.text: These bones are what I expected. Perfect for Radiology school! Most of the markings are on the bones and easy to see. Would recommend this product

customer_reviews.title: Great product and service
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. Fast shipping and outstanding customer service. Took care of a slight issue I had above my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: This skeleton is perfect for Anthropology majors who study osteology. It is affordable and of great quality. I highly recommend this as a study tool!!

customer_reviews.title: I am so happy that I bought this for my anatomy class
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy that I bought this for my anatomy class. I was worried that the bones were not gonna be as detailed but it actually includes bone markings, and surfaces. I highly recommend this product for students!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was a very good resource and an A on my
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to use for my anatomy for nursing school. It was a very good resource and an A on my test
customer_reviews.author: Mary Morgan Nanney

customer_reviews.title: So far everything is great! There are a few inaccuracies
customer_reviews.text: So far everything is great! There are a few inaccuracies, but even in my lab some of the bones aren't great to locate certain things. This will be great to go over and over through out the semester to keep everything fresh!
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Make no bones about it!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to help me study for my lab class in A&P I. So glad I did! Well made and easy to study from.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Gouldey

customer_reviews.title: Not super detailed, but good enough to get a grasp ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it can't be beaten. Not super detailed, but good enough to get a grasp of all the major parts.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very detailed and accurate. I used this to help me study bones in an anatomy class.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Accuracy for Study
customer_reviews.text: Excellent learning aid for anatomy. Has all the accurate landmarks in both the skull and the bones. You'll ace your next skeletal system test with this models support.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price. There are DEFINITELY visible lines from the casting and some of the foramen on the skull are off.
customer_reviews.author: j hanlon

customer_reviews.title: Helped me with A &P
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my A&P Class, this helped me score an amazing grade. Thank you for having this.

customer_reviews.title: was excited when it came in the mail, but ...
customer_reviews.text: was excited when it came in the mail, but there were some issues with the bones that i didn't notice until i was studying. there were random markings on some of the bones and inaccurate foramina in the skull. i'm returning.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for studying
customer_reviews.text: Yes, there are some flaws but it works perfect for me to study all the landmarks. Best purchase I have made for school!

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. I was able to study on my own time rather than the crowded study lab in my school. Got a 100% on my bone practical!!!

customer_reviews.title: Great price for quality
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly detailed for a PVC cast. Great price for quality. Effective learning tool.

customer_reviews.text: Happy with the product. Life size and felt real with the bones to study anatomy.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Better than I expected for the price and fast delivery.

customer_reviews.title: The bones are good quality but one of my femurs were completely ruined ...
customer_reviews.text: The casting is a real problem. The bones are good quality but one of my femurs were completely ruined because of the casting.
customer_reviews.author: dana alhindi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for A&P! We got wonderful price because of Halloween. Very Blessed :)

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I needed and a great way for me to study for my anatomy class
customer_reviews.author: Kacy

customer_reviews.title: Great all around teaching skeleton for the price.
customer_reviews.text: A very nice skeleton that we use for teaching in Anatomy and Physio labs. Has all structures needed for basic teaching. As some have mentioned there are mold lines in some bones, but they are obviously not a bone feature, and I suppose you could sand them off. The bones are stiffer than some, which we like due to less un-natural bending of the longer bones. We also like the magetic skull closures which are better than the hook/eyelet versions. Excellent price. Comes with plastic vertebral discs. We don't use them, but could be good if you want to string the vertebrae together showing a more natural view of the spine.
customer_reviews.author: PDobbins Work

customer_reviews.title: but bones are sturdy and exactly like the ones i have in my ...
customer_reviews.text: Does not connect to each other or have a stand to go on, but bones are sturdy and exactly like the ones i have in my anatomy lab
customer_reviews.author: Amanda I.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was supposed to be a full size male replica, but it was smaller than my (female) bones.

customer_reviews.title: Timely delivered
customer_reviews.text: The bones come properly wrap and protected. For being not being real bones, the bones have a lot of detail. Given that I also have used real ones in the classroom setting it gives me as a student a way to study at home. Certain details were not present but I'm using this as an extra resort for outside classroom review. I think this really does its purpose as an additional aid for any anatomy or nursing student to study. I'm so glad I ordered it. I love that the only articulated bones are for one foot and one hand. It allows me to see other individual bones such as the hips, sternum, ribs, etc.
customer_reviews.author: AleShop

customer_reviews.title: Very detailed and amazing poster!
customer_reviews.text: Great for students who have to take A&P or are interested in the human body.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

product_meta.title: Disarticulated Human Skeleton, Full, Medical Quality, Life Sized (62" Model Height) - 23 Intervertebral Discs, 3 Part Skull with Movable Jaw, Left Hand and Foot Jointed
feature_bullets: Life sized male skeleton model, 62" tall before disarticulation, 23 intervertebral discs, 3 part skull with movable jaw
Extraordinary amount of anatomical details represented including 200+ bones and structures
Left hand and foot jointed, right hand and foot fully disarticulated
Very detailed medical quality anatomical model skeleton with bony landmarks, skeleton is not meant to be assembled and does not come with a stand

The skull has all structures present and the calvaria (skull cap) is removable with access to internal structure and it has the external acoustic meatus, the skull does not include nasal bones and there are no interior markings (such as the sphenoid), the mandible is not detachable (held in place by a spring)
